resource.name: Municipal Property Tax Rates
resource.description: The dataset is a list of property tax rates that are applicable in each municipality in the Province. These rates are applied to property assessment (based on market value) which can change from year to year. The convention is to express the tax rate as per $100 of assessment e.g., Amherst's residential rate is $1.63 per $100 of assessment.

domain_metadata.value: This information has been gathered from Statement of Estimate Reports as submitted to the Province by municipalities. The municipalities are required to submit this informaiton to the Province by Sepember 30th of each year.  Municipalities may also have additional area rates for special services on top of the general rate. Users are cautioned these tax rates are for general reference only, for official rates please contact the appropriate Municipality.   The Cape Breton Suburban rate is an average of 8 various rural suburban tax rates within the county of Cape Breton.    Effective April 1st, 2020, the Town of Windsor and the Municipality of West Hants have consolidated into a regional municipality, West Hants Regional Municipality.
Annually from each fiscal year, from 09-10 to 20-21 (April 1, 2009 to March 31, 2021)

resource.name: Road Weight Designations
resource.description: The Public Works Road Weight Designations dataset provides information on allowable weights for all roads owned by the Nova Scotia Department of Public Works.

domain_metadata.value: The Road Weight Designations dataset is for reference only and is not an authoritative source. The Department of Justice provides authoritative information through the Road List Regulations  made under subsection 191(1A) of the Motor Vehicle Act.

resource.name: Agricultural Land Protection
resource.description:
This dataset provides information about how agricultural land is being protected through municipal land use planning. Each municipality is listed along with the level of agricultural land protection found within municipal land use plans. Agricultural protection is described as either exclusive zoning for agricultural land, agriculture identified as permitted use, or no planning for agriculture. 

Assessment of Agricultural Protection
Municipal planning strategies and land-use by-laws were assessed to determine the level of protection being given to agricultural land in the province. 
Three levels of protection have been identified through the planning document review:
1) Exclusive zoning for agricultural land meaning that agricultural land is identified and given a specific zoning with the intent of protecting agricultural land, activities and resources. 
2) Agriculture identified as a permitted use in other zones (rural residential, rural resource/development,industrial etc). Many of these zones have restrictions on certain agricultural uses, such as intensive livestock operations.
3) No planning for agriculture identifies municipalities that either do not have comprehensive municipal planning strategies or do not explicitly identify agriculture or agricultural activities within their planning strategies and land use bylaws.

domain_metadata.value: Data is a result of a scan done by Provincial planning employees but has not been vetted by the Municipalities.

resource.description: Ocean current speed and direction time series data collected in vertical profile at various locations throughout the waters of Victoria County by the Department of Fisheries and Aquaculture’s Aquaculture Division.

domain_metadata.value: This database consists of data from multiple discrete collection events varying widely in instrument make, model, configuration, capability and installation location. These characteristics should be taken into consideration when comparing or otherwise analyzing data from this database. The attached 20210315_Victoria_County_Current_Data_Deployment_Details contains a summary of deployment specifications related to individual data sets within this database. Each instrument deployment is assigned a unique ID which can be used to filter and separate individual data sets for export from the Open Data Portal.   Data collected using Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCPs) consist of time-series measurements of ocean current speed and direction collected in vertical profile through the water column and divided into measurement cells of specified size.  These readings are arranged from top to bottom in chronological order and from left to right in order of cell distances from the face of the instrument. For example: the column WaterSpeed_1 contains data collected in the cell nearest to the instrument. The exact location of individual cells within the water column is a function of the altitude of the instrument above the sea floor, the specified size of the individual cells and the blanking distance of the instrument in its current configuration.  These attributes for a given dataset can be found in the attached 20210315_Victoria_County_Current_Data_Deployment_Details.  Each individual row of data (Ensemble) presents speed and direction measurements for each measurement cell that have been averaged from multiple individual measurements (Pings) over a specified time period (Averaging Interval).  The Ensemble Interval (time between averaged measurements), the Averaging Interval and the Number of Pings averaged can vary between data sets depending on the configuration of the instrument used for a given deployment.  Because these data are collected in vertical profile at locations of varying depths and tidal ranges, most dat

resource.name: Atlantic Quarterly Autumn 2017 Tobacco and E-cigarette Use
resource.description: Data set is results of commissioned questions the Atlantic Quarterly omnibus public opinion survey conducted in November 2017.  The questions relate to public opinion and behaviour regarding “underground economy” (purchasing contraband tobacco) and tobacco and ecigarette use.  Overall results are provided for each question and results are presented by demographic markers (age, gender, geographic region, education level and household income).

domain_metadata.value: Service Nova Scotia and Internal Services

resource.name: Nova Scotia Topographic DataBase - Utilities (Line Layer)
resource.description:
Part of the Nova Scotia Topographic Database (NSTDB), the utilities theme layer is updated and maintained from aerial photography, and verified with field inspections. Pipelines, Tanks and electrical substations are collected among other types of features. Utility feature codes and their descriptions are provided with the download in a NSTDB feature code table.
Data download also available via GeoNova: https://nsgi.novascotia.ca/WSF_DDS/DDS.svc/DownloadFile?tkey=fhrTtdnDvfytwLz6&id=17
Map service view also available via GeoNova: https://nsgiwa.novascotia.ca/arcgis/rest/services/BASE/BASE_NSTDB_10k_Utilities_UT83/MapServer?f=jsapi

domain_metadata.value: Service Nova Scotia and Internal Services

For additional information on the dataset, see: 1. https://www.nsgc.gov.ns.ca/mappingspecs/Specifications/Compilation/Resource_NSTDB/default.htm ; 2. the Topographic 1:10,000 digital index https://nsgi.novascotia.ca/datalocator/indexing/ (use the identify tool within the application to click on individual mapsheets to view); 3. index web map service that labels the 1:10,000 index, showing the year of photography used to update each mapsheet https://nsgiwa.novascotia.ca/arcgis/rest/services/BASE/BASE_Index_NSTDB_10k_WM84/MapServer
Lower Left Extent = N 43°00', E -66° 30', Upper Right Extent = N 47° 30', -59°00' UTM NAD83 (CSRS)

resource.name: [ARCHIVED] Census Long Form Citizenship and Immigration
resource.description: [ARCHIVED] Community Counts data is retained for archival purposes only, such as research, reference and record-keeping. This data has not been maintained or updated. Users looking for the latest information should refer to Statistics Canada’s Census Program (https://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/index-eng.cfm?MM=1) for the latest data, including detailed results about Nova Scotia. This table reports where residents were born. This data is sourced from the Census of Population (long form). Geographies available: provinces, counties, communities, municipalities, district health authorities, community health boards, economic regions, police districts, school boards, school areas, municipal electoral districts, provincial electoral districts, federal electoral districts, regional development authorities, watersheds

resource.name: Municipal General Operating Expenses by Source - 10 Years Summary
resource.description: Non-consolidated statement of expenses of the General Operating Fund (by expense category) - Regionals, Rurals and Towns for the last 10 fiscal years (2010-2011 to 2019-2020)

resource.name: 1:10,000 Nova Scotia Secondary Watersheds
resource.description:
1:10,000 watersheds for Nova Scotia. Contains secondary watersheds.
Also available via GeoNova at: https://nsgi.novascotia.ca/WSF_DDS/DDS.svc/DownloadFile?tkey=fhrTtdnDvfytwLz6&id=82

domain_metadata.value: Contains secondary watersheds. Includes watershed codes, common names, and flow direction. Primary, tertiary, and sub-tertiary watershed datasets also available on the Open Data portal: https://data.novascotia.ca/browse?tags=nswatersheds

resource.name: Nova Scotia Landbased Aquaculture Licenses
resource.description: The Nova Scotia Department of Fisheries and Aquaculture is the lead regulatory of aquaculture leasing and licensing.  This file illustrates all the issued landbased licenses within Nova Scotia. Fisheries and Aquaculture also provides a mapping tool for this data at: http://novascotia.ca/fish/aquaculture/site-mapping-tool/

domain_metadata.value: Given the fact there are daily updates to this file, please contact the Nova Scotia Department of Fisheries and Aquaculture for the most up-to-date information. The primary software for opening this file is ArcGIS and associated extensions. This file is not to be used for legal purposes or navigation. Nova Scotia Fisheries & Aquaculture accepts no liability for any errors, deficiencies or omissions in this file.
Served through the Nova Scotia Geospatial Infrastucture

resource.name: Nova Scotia Topographic DataBase - Landforms (Spot Point Layer)
resource.description:
Part of the Nova Scotia Topographic Database (NSTDB), the landforms theme layer is updated and maintained from aerial photography. Contours, spot elevations, Cut/fill locations along roadways, as well as cliffs and embankments are collected. Landform feature codes and their descriptions are provided with the download in a NSTDB feature code table.
Data download also available via GeoNova: https://nsgi.novascotia.ca/WSF_DDS/DDS.svc/DownloadFile?tkey=fhrTtdnDvfytwLz6&id=14
Map service view also available via GeoNova: https://nsgiwa.novascotia.ca/arcgis/rest/services/BASE/BASE_NSTDB_10k_Landforms_UT83/MapServer?f=jsapi
